intro: Psychotria nuda, commonly known as the naked psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub with smooth, glabrous stems. Its leaves are alternate, ovate to elliptic in shape, and often have a glossy appearance. The flowers are small, white or pale green, and are clustered in umbels, contributing to its ornamental value.
